Class DataListImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.nuiz.parallelRecommend.DataListImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Datum>, DataList
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinaryFileDataList, FileDataList, UserFileDataList
 class DataListImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataList

A base implementation of a DataList

Author:
Robert Newey

Constructor Detail

DataListImpl

public DataListImpl()
Default constructor, This will not become a usable DataList until loadData is called

DataListImpl

public DataListImpl(DataListImpl dli)
Copy constructor, this creates a new DataListImpl backed by the one passed in. Constant time, constant memory

Parameters:
dli - The DataListImpl to copy

DataListImpl

public DataListImpl(java.util.List<Datum> v)
Creates a DataListImpl backed by a List of Data

Parameters:
v - List of Data to load

DataListImpl

public DataListImpl(java.util.List<Datum> v,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> users,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> items,
                    int maxItem)
Creates a DataListImpl backed by the arguments passed in

Parameters:
v - List of Data to use
users - Set containing user ids in v. Equality is preferable, but supersets are allowed
items - Set containing item ids in v. Equality is preferable, but supersets are allowed
maxItem - The largest item id in v.

loadData

public void loadData(java.util.List<Datum> v)
Sets this DataListImpl to be backed by the provided list

Parameters:
v - List of Data to back this DataListImpl

normaliseRating

public double normaliseRating(Datum data)
Description copied from interface: DataList
Given a datapoint, normalises it in accordance with the DataList implementation. This transformation is the inverse of denormaliseRating.

Specified by:
normaliseRating in interface DataList
Parameters:
data - Datum to normalise.
Returns:
The normalised rating from the datum.

denormaliseRating

public double denormaliseRating(int user,
                                double rating)
Description copied from interface: DataList
Given a datapoint, denormalises it in accordance with the DataList implementation. This transformation is the inverse of normaliseRating.

Specified by:
denormaliseRating in interface DataList
Parameters:
user - the user to denormalise for
rating - the rating to denormalise
Returns:
The denormalised rating from the datum.
